hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity-Driven Volatility Expansion on ETH/BTC Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: A daily close of ETH/BTC above its 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std) during NEUTRAL regimes will lead to continued momentum, with ETH outperforming BTC by 5-8% over the next 3 days, as thin liquidity amplifies the breakout move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Breakouts during low-liquidity periods face less immediate selling pressure. ETH/BTC moves often signal broader altcoin rotation. The combination of technical breakout confirmation and relative volume shift suggests sustainable momentum.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC daily close > 20-day BB upper band (2 std)
BTC daily volume < 20-day average volume * 0.8 (confirming liquidity focus shift)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC drops back below 20-day BB midline

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such breakouts immediately reverse (close back inside BB within 2 days) instead of continuing.
